definition: lit. presenting the Buddha with borrowed flowers (idiom); fig. to win favor or influence using sb else's property/plagiarism
to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)

sentences.english: Be shy of favours bestowed at the expense of others.
sentences.chinese: 享用借花獻佛的恩惠是要付出代價的。

sentences.english: We are publishing it as part of our tribute to Charles Darwin on his 200th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 借花獻佛，以此向達爾文誕辰200週年獻禮。
